He started with capital earned from agriculture which he practiced for a long period. He says price fluctuation is a factor affecting his business. He would like to educate his children and buy land to grow crops and diversify his business. Kiziito wants a loan to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Sam Ol

texts.en:
Sam Ol, age 44, earns a living by selling fish. She has been engaged in this work for over 10 years and she earns approximately $10 per day. She lives with her husband and their four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is a hairdresser who earns about $3 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sam Ol is requesting a loan of $1,100 in order to purchase a motorcycle for commuting. This purchase will help her to transport her fish to sell in larger amounts, allowing her to earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a truck for carrying her fish to market and to help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Mansurjon

texts.en:
Mansurjon is a young man who has been engaged in farming since early childhood, when he helped his father in farming. When he became older, Mansurjon decided to take on his father’s business himself. 

Nowadays, he is a successful businessmen. He keeps livestock at the family home and also grows vegetables. He is not yet married and lives with his parents, who are glad to have him with them and who help Mansurjon in his work. 

His primary goal is to develop his business, which is why he is asking for a loan. He will utilize the loan funds to buy livestock. He is grateful for your help.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to develop his business

loans.name: Ligia Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Mundo Natural.

En este lugar vive la señora Ligia, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. El marido es empleado privado. 

Nuestra amiga se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y también a la venta de recargas telefónicas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza  en su  casa ya que también se desempeña como auxiliar contable en un negocio que es de su papá y allí aprovecha para realizar sus ventas tanto de ropa como de las recargas telefónicas al mismo tiempo que realiza su trabajo de contadora. Trabaja de lunes a sábado en todas sus actividades. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Huaquillas cada vez que necesita, ella lleva más de 5 años con su negocio de ropa que es el que más ganancias le deja.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los padres.
texts.en:
The members of the “Mi Mundo Natural” (My Natural World) communal bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Ligia, 24, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children, a nine-year-old and a six-year-old both of whom attend school.  Her husband is a private employee.

Our friend sells all types of clothes and also sells telephone recharges.  She sells door to door.  Most of her sales take place at home since she also works as an accounting assistant in her father’s business and takes advantage of this to sell clothing and telephone charges there while doing her accounting work.  She works Monday through Saturday in all her activities.  She goes to Huaquillas to buy merchandise whenever she needs to.  She’s been in the clothing business more than five years and it’s the most profitable one.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s a founding member of the communal banks and likes it because interest rates are lower than in other credit institutions.  Her dream is to have a house of her own since she lives in her parents’ house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 42 year-old married with four children living in Kagadi,Uganda.  He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for sixteen years.  His major challenge is a low salary coupled with price fluctuations and inflation.  He would like to build a permanent house for residence and venture into crop farming.  Christopher wants a loan to buy land for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy land for cultivation.

loans.name: Laith

texts.en: Laith, who appears in the picture, is a 21-year-old single young man. He is employed and gets a low salary that is not enough to cover his needs. He is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop. This will help him to enhance his skills in using the computer and to finish his work reports on time, which will ensure better conditions for him at work and improve his income.

loans.use: To purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is a very kind woman. Her father died when she was small and that’s why she had a difficult life in childhood. She had a dream to comfort her children with all of the things they need. Nowadays she is a very good mother for her children. She tries to find new ways of making an income. 

She has been busy for 7 years with keeping livestock. Her business has developed year by year. As her house is not in good condition, she decided to repair her house. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the taxi in order to improve its condition.

loans.name: Delmy Guadalupe

texts.es: Delmy Guadalupe de veintiséis años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos uno de un año y el otro de tres, ella posee un empleo de mesera en un restaurante y ya tiene varios años de trabajar ahí sus compañeros de trabajo y su jefe dan fe de que es una buena persona, confiable y muy honrada; es una mujer entregada a su labor y a su hogar siempre está dispuesta a dar su mejor esfuerzo para regalarle  a su familia un futuro próspero, su tiempo libre es el más valioso lo aprovecha para estar en su casa junto a  sus hijos para ella el hogar es lo más importante, desde hace algún tiempo su vivienda ha sufrido deterioros en el techo pero ahora que viene la época de lluvias necesita repararlos para más comodidad y seguridad de sus hijos, necesita realizar la inversión en compra de material pero no posee del capital suficiente por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, duralita, polín, cemento etc. Delmy Guadalupe tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable tiene la seguridad que logrará pagar la deuda y a la vez llevara a su hogar la  seguridad económica que se merecen.
texts.en: Delmy Guadalupe is twenty-six years old and she lives with her two children aged 1 and 3. She is a waitress in a restaurant, an activity she has been engaged in for various years. Her colleagues and her chief testify she is a good, trustworthy and very honest person. She is dedicated to her job and to her household, and she is always ready to do her best to offer a prosperous future to her family. She makes the most of her free time by spending it in her house close to her children, as to her family is the most important thing. Recently the roof of her house has been damaged and as the rain season is approaching she needs to have it repaired to grant more comfort and safety to her children. She needs to buy materials but she does not have enough money, so she is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL to buy Duralita (cardboard reinforced cement roofing), idler and cement. Delmy Guadalupe has good credit references and she is very responsible. She is sure she will succeed in repaying her dues and that she will grant her family the economic security they deserve.

loans.use: To buy Duralita (cardboard reinforced cement roofing), idler and cement.

loans.name: Francisco Pacheco  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Francisco Pacheco de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Francisco Pacheco, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace tiempo atrás  y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos han mejorado  sus pequeños negocios y su vida. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como venta de comida, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.

Aquí  vive la señora Glenda, tiene 33 años de edad, mantiene una relación libre hace varios años de la cual ha tenido dos hijos de 9 y 7 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a actividades varias no tiene un trabajo fijo.

Nuestra amiga es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al dia, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que según dice son muy buenos.	

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo.  Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera y le gusta el Banco por la ayuda que recibe para salir adelante.
Su sueño es son es tener estabilidad económica.

Las fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Francisco Pacheco” communal bank meets in the Francisco Pachecho neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo every fifteen days.  This is a densely populated, marginal urban area in this city.

This is a group of people who decided to join together some time ago and form this communal bank that’s been very useful for them since they’ve improved their small businesses and their lives with the loans.  They are in a variety of activities like food sales, general commerce and services, among other activities.

Glenda, 33, lives here.  She’s been in a common law relationship for several years and has two children who are 9 and 7-years-old and are attending school.  Her husband does odd jobs since he does not have a steady job.

Our friend is a housewife who in order to earn her own income to help her husband with household expenses sells clothes via catalogue and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week from two to three hours daily.  She sells her products on credit and collects payment weekly.  She’s been in this activity four years and does very well.  She tells us that what she sells the most is perfume and cosmetics which according to her are very good.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics and all types of clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because of the help she gets to get ahead.  Her dream is to have economic stability.

The small photos are of two members who were unable to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Teresa, tiene 40 de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque el banco le ha brindado una gran ayuda con los créditos para salir adelante.

Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres, allí además de vender productos  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, también vende helados, sodas y ciertas medicinas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00. Nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio 19 años y que gracias a los créditos lo fue aumentando poco a poco hasta tener el negocio bien surtido que tiene actualmente.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. 

Su meta es tener un carro.
texts.en:
The “Los Tres Ángeles” (The Three Angels) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts that are known nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

We met Teresa, 40, here.  She’s single living in her parents’ house.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because the bank has given her great help with the loans to get ahead.

Our friend has a store in her parents’ house where besides selling products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent also sells ice-cream, sodas and certain medicines.  She works every day from 6am until 10pm.  She tells us that she’s been in business 19 years and thanks to the loans has gradually increased in until having the well-stocked store she currently has.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats and other basic staple items.  Her goal is to own a car.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 32 years old. She is married and resides with her mother and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $6 per day. They are rice farmers as well. 

In order to make her farm work easier, Sokha is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help improve her business.

In the future, she would like to purchase rice to store in the warehouse to sell when the price is higher and to run a grocery store at home. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family; she also wants to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland.

loans.name: Leak

texts.en:
Leak is 20 years old. She is married. She lives with her mother and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving plastic baskets to sell for more than four years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $4 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Leak is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase plastic to use for weaving baskets. This loan is used to purchase plastic baskets from villagers to resell as well. By doing so, she would be able to earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase plastic to use for weaving baskets.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer, who appears in the picture, is a 22-year-old single young man. He is an interior designer, which has been a profitable project, especially in that he has a good reputation among his customers.

Thaer wants to improve and expand his work and increase the number of his designs, so he is requesting a 1,200 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new computer. This will increase his amount of work, ensure a better future and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a computer.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 33 years old. She is married and resides with her mother and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $4 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Chantha is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase plastic to use for weaving baskets to sell when she is free from work. This loan will also be used to purchase farmland for cultivating agricultural crops. By doing so, she would be able to generate additional income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase plastic to use for weaving baskets to sell when she is free from work.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower, age 22, owns a car tire maintenance garage. He has been in this business since 2011. He is married. He and his wife do not yet have children.

Hasan has gained strong experience in his field as well as a deep understanding of local customers and an understanding of market needs. He has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1,200 “youth loan” in order to buy an essential machine for his business. He is aiming to grow his business and to increase his profits so that he will be able to better provide for his family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy an essential machine for his business

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer, age 30, is a taxi driver. His salary isn't enough to cover his needs, so for the past five years, Samer has also run a store where he sells cosmetics. This has been a profitable project, but Samer needs more support to cover the costs of operating the business.

He is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN in order to help him cover the costs of purchasing a collection of cosmetics. This will increase sales and improve Samer's income.

Samer is shown here photographed in his store.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to offer for sale

loans.name: Marta Elida

texts.es: Marta Elida de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y dos nietos en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad frijoles, pan, huevos, jabón, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y le ha dado muy buenos resultados, su tienda está ubicada en un lugar estratégico y tiene mucha clientela pues todas las personas la prefieren porque es la más surtida, con productos de calidad, a buenos precios pero sobre todo con el mejor servicio; Marta es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere llegar al éxito y luchara duro hasta lograrlo, desde hace algún tiempo ha aumentado la demanda y necesita invertir pero no posee de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Marta es muy responsable y con buenas referencias de crédito asegura que pagara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Marta Elida is sixty-four years old and she lives with her life partner and two grandchildren in her own house. She owns a shop where she sells basic necessities such as beans, bread, eggs, soap and more. She has been in this line of business for many years and it has given her good results. Her shop is located in a strategic place and she has many customers as everybody prefers her because her shop is the best supplied, she sells quality products at good prices and above all she provides the best service. Marta is a resourceful woman with a great desire to progress in life. She wants to reach success and she will fight hard to achieve it. Recently there has been an increase in her requests and she needs to invest but she does not have enough money, so she is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL to buy basic grains, instant foods, sweets and drinks. Marta is very responsible and she has good credit references. She is sure she will repay her due and that she will provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, instant foods, sweets and drinks.

loans.name: Jorge Luís

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Mundo Natural.

En este lugar el señor Jorge, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no tiene  hijos, su esposa trabaja de cajera en una discoteca en la ciudad de Manta. 

Nuestro amigo trabaja por las noches junto a su esposa en una discoteca en la ciudad de Manta y en las tardes él también se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo, sus forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa ya que allí su esposa le ayuda  mientras él sale a recorrer por la ciudad. Nos cuenta que lleva más de cuatro  años realizando esta actividad comercial y les va muy bien, la mercadería la va a traer el mismo desde Guayaquil ya que allá consigue más barato y mayor variedad de productos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva más de dos años en el banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y facilidad  para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un negocio más estable con un local propio.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, known as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees since the colonial period, the members of the Banco Comunal Mi Mundo Natural “My Natural World Community Bank" meet every 15 days.  Here we find Jorge who is 26-years-old and living in a common-law marriage with no children.  His wife works as a cashier in a discotheque in the city of Manta.  Our friend works at night with his wife in the discotheque in the city of Manta and in the afternoons he also makes a living in commerce selling clothing of all kinds.  He sells door-to-door and also from his house where his wife helps him while he goes out all around the city.  He tells us that he been doing this commercial activity for more than four years and it’s going very well for them.  He is going to bring the same kind of merchandise from Guayaquil since there he can get a cheaper and greater variety of products.

He is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as:  pants, blouses, t-shirts and childrens clothing.  He has been with the communal bank for more than two years and he likes it because of the assistance and ease with which he can obtain loans.  His dream is to have a more stable business with its own location.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothing.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 18 y de 16 años  de edad, el mayor estudia en universidad y los dos menores están en colegio. Su esposo es artesano.
 
Nuestra amiga tiene un local en un lugar de bastante acogida turística, en este lugar vende artesanías de todo tipo, pulseras, sombreros, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio cuando ellos están desocupados y más que todo los fines de semana días en que este lugar es mas concurrido y es cuando más ventas realiza, sus productos los compra a artesanos en Montecristi, lleva 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y con su local 4 años.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanías para incrementar la mercadería en su local. Lleva más de dos años en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos puede financiar su negocio. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Los Tres Ángeles” (The Three Angels) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts that are known nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

We met María, 40, here.  She’s married and has three children who are 19, 18 and 16 years of age.  The oldest studies at the university and the two younger ones are in secondary school.  Her husband is a craftsman.

Our friend has a locale in a spot with quite a large tourist presence where she sells all types of crafts like bracelets and hats, among other things.  She works every day from 8am until 6pm.  Her children help her in her business when they are unoccupied and above all on weekends which is when the place is most crowded and sales are highest.  She buys her products from craftsmen in Montecristi.  She’s been in this business 15 years and has had her locale for 4 years.

She will use this loan to buy more crafts to increase stock merchandise in her locale.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than two years and likes it because she can finance her business with the loans.  Her dreams are to continue forward with her business and to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy crafts.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a 32-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to two sons. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and to pay the medical expenses.

Tamara suffers from a pain in her back and her right leg and she needs urgent surgery, so she is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her pay her medical expenses. This will improve her health and enable her to live under normal conditions with the family. Tamara is photographed in the picture while she is in the hospital.

loans.use: To pay her medical expenses.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy is 44 years old. She is married and blessed with six children, living in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs a business of producing charcoal to sell. He earns about $4 per day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Dy is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a rice grinding machine to use for rental. This money will help her generate additional income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a rice grinding machine to use for rental.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, who appears in the picture taken in his grocery store, is a 23-year-old single young man. For the past five years, Ahmad has been selling groceries to customers, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him, but he needs more support to cover his needs.

He is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more groceries and a refrigerator to conserve dairy products and soft drinks. This will increase sales and improve Ahmad's income.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Kholikul

texts.en: Kholikul has a very interesting kind of business. For more than 4 years he has been busy with his own business deal. He sells national boxes and chests in which local people can keep some things. Kholikul is a very successful business man. For 4 years his business has developed year by year. He has a lovely wife and 2 beautiful children. Kholikul is a very careful father. They love Kholikul very much. He wants to widen his business and that’s why he is asking for a loan to buy more goods for developing his business. Kholikul awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy more goods for developing his business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, age 27, is a carpenter. He been engaged in his carpentry business since 2000. He and his wife have one child. 

In his business, Ali makes doors, bedroom closets, and other items of furniture. He has strong experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge of market demand. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1,300 "youth loan" in order to buy a necessary machine for his business and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to better provide for his family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a necessary machine for his business and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es: La alcancía comunal llamada Mujeres Emprendedoras de Micaela Bastida, es un grupo conformado por 7 socios y con buenas ideas para los negocios de hoy en día. Una de las integrantes es Tereza con una historia en particular de éxito y progreso, Tereza tiene 54 años de edad casada con cuatro hijos que ha sabido sacarlo adelante con el esfuerzo de un pequeño negocio que puso hace mas de 25 años el cual es el negocio de venta de especiarias y condimentos. De esta manera a sabido sobresalir siempre para adelante. Con el fruto del negocio y la ayuda de su esposo a podido darle una vida digna a sus hijos y una economía estable para su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo piensa invertirlo en invertir en el negocio en las compras de condimentos. Como la señora Tereza cada integrante tiene una historia en particular pero si en algo coinciden es en el empeño que ponen, ante cada desafío que les presenta la vida, en lucha por el bienestar de sus familias y sus mejoras económicas
texts.en: This communal bank is called "Mujeres Emprendedoras D. Micaela Bastida" (Micaela Bastida's Enterprising Women). The group is composed of 7 members with good ideas for today’s activities. Tereza is a member of the group and hers is a special story of success and progress. Tereza is 54 years old, she is married and she has four children whom she has been able to provide for with the great contribution of the small activity she started more than 25 years ago: she sells spices and dressings. Through this activity she has always succeeded in getting ahead. Thanks to the profits of her shop and to her husband’s help she has succeeded in offering a dignified life to her children and to provide a stable income for her family. The loan she is now requesting will be used to buy dressings. Just like Tereza, every member of the group has a special story, but these all meet in the effort with which they face every challenge coming up in their lives, fighting for the wellbeing of their families as well as for their economic improvements.

loans.use: To buy dressings.

loans.name: Adiela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Adiela es madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo ya que su padre los abandonó hace un tiempo, y para generar los ingresos que se requieren en su hogar tenía un empleo hasta hace unas semanas; luego de esto quedó desempleada y durante unos días logró sostener los gastos de su hogar con los ahorros que tenía de su empleo, y gracias a que era muy disciplinada con los ahorros tuvo un poco de capital para poder estar bien económicamente durante unos pocos días. Al ver la necesidad de tener un empleo visualizó la oportunidad que había de montar su propio negocio, pues en su municipio solo existe una venta de helados y la atención es muy mala; fue así como montó su propio negocio de venta de helados con unos ahorros y sacando fiado algunos artículos. El negocio lo tiene abierto hace aproximadamente 1 semana y gracias a la buena atención que ofrece tiene muy buenas ventas, por esto busca un préstamo para comprar insumos que se han agotado y también para terminar de pagar los artículos que sacó fiado.

De esta manera podrá terminar de montar su negocio y comenzar a operar en este de una mejor manera, comenzando a generar los ingresos que se requieren en su hogar y brindando a su hijo una buena calidad de vida. Su mayor sueño es darle a su hijo una educación universitaria y tener una buena estabilidad económica que les permita progresar.
texts.en:
Adiela is a single mother, head of household since the father of her son abandoned them some time ago.  In order to generate household income she had a job up to a few weeks ago but then she lost the job and for a few days was able to support her household with savings she had.  Thanks to being very disciplined her savings gave her economic stability for a few days.  

Seeing the need to have a job she visualized the opportunity of having her own business since there is only one ice-cream shop in her town and service is very bad there.  This is how she opened her own ice-cream shop with some of her savings and by buying some items on credit.  

The business has been open for about a week and thanks to the good service she provides sales have been very good which is why she’s looking for a loan to buy supplies she’s run out of and also to finish paying off the items she bought on credit.

In his way she will finish setting up her business and start to operate in it better starting to generate income needed for her home and providing her son with a good quality of life.  Her greatest dream is to give her son a university education and to have good economic stability that will allow them to make progress.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and to pay off items she bought on credit.

loans.name: Kiara Lissette

texts.es: Kiara vive en Milagros a sus 20 años de manera independiente hace 3 años. de momento se encuentra soltera y sin hijos ya que se dedica a su negocio por ser la única fuente de dinero. Empezó en el microcrédito a los 17 años vendiendo productos en el colegio, le gustaba mucho y tenía bastante acogida. En el colegio lo hacía por medio de una tía quien era su representante ante la empresa porque era menor de edad, ya en la universidad reunió un capital y se inscribió de manera independiente. Kiara menciona que en este tipo de negocio no hay horario de entrada y salida visita a sus clientes previa cita cuando la llaman por teléfono. Se traslada por medio de buses llevando los productos en una maleta para ofrecerlo, también lleva revistas actualizadas por si le solicitan pedidos. Como se traslada con productos su mayor inconveniente es la delincuencia ya que perdería su mercadería. Lo que más vende son perfumes, cremas, joyas, maquillaje etc., el crédito que está solicitando lo utilizara en la compra de una vitrina y productos para tener de inventario.
texts.en: Kiara lives in Milagros.  She is 20 years old and has been living independently for three years.  She is currently single and does not have any children.  Her business is her sole source of income.  Kiara started working with micro loans at the age of 17, selling products at her high school.  She enjoyed her work and her business was quite popular.  At school, she made her sales through an aunt who was her representative with the company [who provided her products] because she was a minor.  When she went to University, she gathered together some capital and signed up as an independent vendor.  Kiara mentions that, in this type of business, there are no official hours.  She visits her customers when they call her on the phone and arrange a visit.  She travels on buses, carrying the products that she sells in a suitcase.  She also carries up-to-date magazines in case her customers make orders with her.  As she has to travel about with her products, Kiara's major problem is crime as she could lose her merchandise.  What she sells most of are perfumes, creams jewelry and makeup.  She is requesting this loan to buy a display case and some products so that she has a good stock.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, jewelry and makeup

loans.name: Suhtobjon

texts.en: For the last six years, Suhtobjon has been busy with his own business. His business has developed year by year. Suhtobjon’s skills help him to be successful in business. He sells sweets in the local market such as chocolate, biscuits, candy and another products. His colleagues know him as a kind and active person. He is widower with no children. He lives with his parents and his father helps him in business. Suhtobjon wants to increase his selection and that’s why he is asking for a loan to buy additional goods.  Suhtobjon waits for your help.

loans.use: to buy goods to increase the selection.

loans.name: Leap

texts.en: Leap is 55 years-old. She is married and blessed with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling bananas for more than ten years, earning approximately $15 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 per day. One of her children is employed and earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Leap is requesting a loan of $1000 in order to raise capital for her business in order to purchase more bananas to resell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to purchase a store in the market for selling bananas and to help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to raise capital for her business to purchase more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina patiently sells dried fish to the people in her village at Estefania. She would like to increase her sales and it requires more products to sell in order to achieve it. For this, she is now asking for a loan of P7,000 in order to buy more dried fish to sell including vegetables to increase sales capacity and upgrade her profits too. 

Avelina is now 29 years-old.  She has four young children and is married to a farmer. All she wants is to give the best education to all her children which is the only legacy she can pass to them.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer, age 47, owns and operates a food market business, selling  such items as soft drinks, juices, cheese, and dairy products. He has run his business since 2008. He and his wife have three children.

Amer has strong experience in this field as well as a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $2,000 in order to expand the shop, buy a refrigerator, and add more goods. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to better provide for his family and to offer them better living conditions.

loans.use: to expand the shop, buy a refrigerator, and add more goods

loans.name: Claudia Marcela

texts.es:
Claudia es una persona muy emprendedora y luchadora que haciendo grandes esfuerzos en su vida ha logrado salir adelante. Se formó como enfermera en su ciudad natal y allí desempeñó la actividad durante unos 5 años aproximadamente; luego de este tiempo se quedó sin oportunidades laborales y fue por esto que se trasladó hasta la ciudad de Medellín con el ánimo de encontrar mejores oportunidades para progresar. Cuando arribó a la ciudad buscó oportunidades y así comenzó a trabajar en una empresa, y al mismo tiempo se estaba preparando como masajista; luego de que terminó su preparación decidió con unos ahorros que tenía montar su propio centro de belleza, y fue así como inició con su propio negocio el cual ya tiene unos meses de estar funcionando, y gracias a la buena calidad de los servicios que ofrece ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes. Actualmente tiene muy buenos clientes y cada vez vienen en aumento, y debido a que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para poder seguir haciendo crecer su negocio, Claudia busca apoyo en un préstamo que le permita comprar un equipo de vacunterapia digital para seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad de servicios a sus clientes.

De esta manera logrará superar las adversidades de capital que presenta y seguir así ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Su mayor sueño es seguir progresando en la vida y seguir teniendo unos buenos ingresos para seguir ofreciendo a sus padres mejores oportunidades económicas y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia is a very enterprising, tenacious person who has made great efforts in her life in order to get ahead.  She trained as a nurse in her native city and worked there in that activity for about five years.  After this time she found herself with no employment opportunities which is why she relocated to the city of Medellín hoping to find better opportunities to make progress.

When she arrived in the city she sought opportunities and started working for a firm while training as a masseuse.  When she completed her training she decided to use some savings she had to open her own health and beauty spa which is how she started out with her own business which has been in operation for a few months.  Thanks to the good quality of the services she offers she’s acquired a good number of customers.

She currently has very good customers that are increasing more each time and because she does not have sufficient capital to continue making her business grow Claudia is looking for support from a loan to buy digital vacuum therapy equipment to continue to offer a variety of services to her customers.

In this way she will overcome the capital adversity she has and continue to offer good customer service.  Her greatest dream is to continue to make progress in life and continue to earn good income to be able to continue to offer her parents better economic opportunities and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy digital vacuum therapy equipment.

loans.name: Napoleon Gabriel

texts.es: Napoleón vive en Milagros con sus padres ya que es soltero. Tiene 23 años y se dedica a la venta ambulante de colas, gatorade, deli y vivan que son refrescos. A su edad nos comenta que le gusta mucho  su trabajo y que al no conseguir trabajo es una manera honrada de ganarse la vida. El trabajo lo realiza solo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, visitando a sus clientes y entregandos los pedidos. La razón de éxito de su negocio es que llega a lugares muy apartados donde los vendedores normalmente no llegarían, ese es el motivo de su miedo ya que los ladrones deambulan por estos sectores. Con el crédito que esta solicitando Napoleon comprara productos para tener de stock y asi dar el primer paso para empezar su distribuidora de consumo masivo.
texts.en: Napoleón lives in Milagros with his parents.  He is 23 years old, single, and sells Cola, Gatorade, Deli and Vivan soft drinks.  He tells us that he really enjoys his work.  As he was unable to find a job, he finds this to be an honest way to make a living.  Napoleón works alone from 8.00am to 4.00pm, visiting his customers and delivering their orders.  The reason his business is successful is that he reaches very distant places which other sellers don't normally reach.  However, this also makes him afraid because there are thieves who hang around in these areas.  Napoleón plans to use this loan to buy products to have in stock.  This will allow him to take his first step in starting to work as a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy Cola, Gatorade and Deli soft drinks

loans.name: Julia Patricia

texts.es: Julia de 32 años se dedica a la confección de ropa. Ella vive en el Paraíso zona sur urbana de Guayaquil con su hijo. Hace 7 años que compro la casa la cual es de cemento y cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz. Actualmente está separada y su hijo de 5 años estudia en la escuela fiscal del barrio. La costura la aprendió desde muy joven ya que le gustaba mucho la moda, luego realizo la academia y siguió varios cursos con lo que obtuvo su título. El taller lo tiene en su casa donde adecuo la sala y coloco las maquinas que tiene. Gracias a Dios Julia cuenta con mucha demanda en su trabajo por lo cuenta con unas señoras quienes le ayudan cuando tiene mucho trabajo. Como su negocio depende de la producción no tiene horario fijo de entrada y salida ya que depende de cuando terminen la producción. Con el crédito Julia comprara una maquina industrial ya que la necesita para la producción en serie de las prendas.
texts.en: Julia is 32 years old and her business is making clothes.  She lives in Paraíso, an urban area in the south of Guayaquil, together with her son.  Seven years ago, Julia bought her own home which is made from cement and has both water and electricity.  She is currently separated and her 5-year-old son is attending a state school in their neighborhood.  Julia learned how to sew when she was very young as she was really into fashion.  She studied at school and then attended a number of courses and obtained a qualification.  The workshop that she has at home, in her living room, has the sewing machines that she needs.  Thanks to God, Julia has a lot of demand for her work.  For this reason, she has some ladies who help her when she has a lot of work.  As her business depends on production, she does not work regular hours.  Her hours depend on when she finishes making her products.  Julia will use her loan to buy an industrial sewing machine that she needs to make her clothing.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Dakhel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, single, and lives with 5 relatives.

Dakhel has a small shop where he sells different types of gadgets. He established his business in 1996. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers, and he knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $2,400 to renew and redecorate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits and develop his business, which, in turn, will affect his life conditions.

loans.use: to renew and redecorate his shop

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 26 years old and lives in the airport community. She stopped her education in 5th grade. She is married and has a two-year-old child who is not in school. When he was working, her husband gave her money to start a business. For two years she has been running a table in the market where she sells rice, oil, pepper, and charcoal. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, oil, pepper, and charcoal for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, pepper, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Gloria Rocio

texts.es: Gloria tiene 33 años y vive en la ciudad de Duran, hace 4 años compro una casa con la ayuda de su esposo. Juan el esposo de Gloria es maestro constructor y lleva 12 años desempeñando esta labor. Tienen 3 hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando en el colegio fiscal. El negocio que tiene Gloria es la cerámica, es decir que hace figuras de cerámicas para adornos o recuerdos. Empezó este negocio por un curso que tomo por curiosidad, le gusto mucho y se dio cuenta que era buena en la pintura. Empezó comprando la pieza y pintándola a su gusto, guiada por la revistas que tenia de los cursos realizados. En su negocio hay que estar abierta a críticas y saber tomarlas en cuenta porque todos los clientes no son iguales. En la actualidad tiene mucha experiencia en esta labor, sobre todo en la creación de las piezas las cuales siguen un proceso: Primero está la creación de la pieza que se elabora con caolín arcilla, cenizas, sílice pulverizada y cal que se mesclan en proporciones logrando una pasta  que es colocada en un molde. Segundo esta el secado al aire libre donde la pieza logra una consistencia más solida que se puede manipular terminado los acabados. Tercero la pieza se coloca en hornos especiales donde se cocina teniendo cuidado de que no sufran un cambio brusco de temperatura ya que podría agrietarla. Se deja enfriar y se procede a pintar al gusto. Hay piezas como los recuerdos que son pintados antes de colocarlos en el horno, es más delicado su manejo pero se termina con un producto muy llamativo y bonito. Gloria solicita el crédito para comprar material para la elaboración de los jarrones esperando mejorar sus ventas. A futuro sueña con poder comprar un carro para poder transportar sus piezas ya que son delicadas.
texts.en: Gloria is 33 years old and lives in the town of Duran. Four years ago, she bought a house with help from her husband. Juan is Gloria's husband; he's a master builder and has been in this line of work for 12 years. They have three children who go to public school. Gloria's business is pottery, that is to say, she makes ceramic figures to serve as ornaments or souvenirs. She started this business because of a course she took out of curiosity - she enjoyed it a lot and realized that she was skilled at painting. She began by buying the piece and painting it her own way, with guidance from the magazines she got from the lessons she took. In her business, she needs to be open to criticism and know how to take it into account, because customers are not all alike. Currently, she's experienced in this line of work, especially in creating the pieces. There's a process for that: first comes the creation of the piece, made out of kaolin, clay, ashes, powdered silica and lime, which are mixed proportionately to form a paste that's poured into a mold. Secondly, there's the drying in open air, when the piece acquires a more solid consistency that can be manipulated for finishing. Thirdly, the piece is placed in special ovens where it's cooked, and attention is paid so that it doesn't suffer a sudden change in temperature, which could cause it to crack. Then it's left for cooling and painted at will. Certain pieces such as the souvenirs are painted before going into the oven - they demand more delicate handling, but the result is a very eye-catching, beautiful product. Gloria requests the loan in order to purchase supplies for making the vases, in hopes of increasing her sales. In the future she dreams of buying a car so that she can transport her pieces, since they're delicate.

loans.use: to purchase kaolin, clay, ashes, powdered silica and lime.

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en: Jennet is 27 years old and lives in the airport community. She stopped her education in the ninth grade. She has three children between four and eleven years old. They are in school and live at home. Since 2010 she has been selling charcoal in her community. She started her business with a small amount of money given to her by her mother, and she manages her business to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to buy bags of charcoal for her business. In the near future she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Qodir

texts.en: Qodir likes to work very hard and tries to be successful in business. He chooses the kind of business that is very popular among local people. For more than six years, Qodir has been keeping livestock. Qodir likes to work in a field or in a garden. He works with pleasure and does his best to develop his business. He is married and has three smart children. Qodir is a very caring father. Some years ago he bought a car with his income, but it is broken now. Qodir wants to repair his car and also to buy livestock to expand his business. Qodir needs your help.

loans.use: to buy livestock to expand his business and to repair his car.

loans.name: Leonardo Francisco

texts.es: Leonardo vive en Playas a sus 21 años se dedica a la pesca. Esta soltero y vive con sus padres. El negocio de la pesca lo aprendió desde los 13 años ya que es negocio familiar, su padre a sido su maestro y le a  enseñado todo lo referente a la navegación y pesca. Le gusta mucho el aire libre, el mar, la libertad que siente cuando labora. Actualmente trabaja con su papa porque el tiene el bote y redes para el labor, sus principales compradores son los restaurantes de la playa y lo pequeños vendedores de la plaza. Su forma de venta en al mayor ya que por volumen es cuando más ganan, los productos que venden son camarones, corvinas y ostras. Leonardo indica que su trabajo es por mareas y por eso es que vive cerca de la playa. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de redes y otras herramientas para poder independizarse ya que su sueño a futuro es empezar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Leonardo has lived his 21 years in Playas and works in fishing. He is single and lives with his parents. He has been learning about fishing for 13 years as it is the family business. His father has been a teacher and has taught him everything about boating and fishing. He likes very much the free air, the sea, the freedom he feels when he works.

Currently he is working with his father because he has the boat and the working relationships. Their main customers are the restaurants along the beach and the small vendors in the plaza. They sell wholesale in volume because they earn more. Their products are shrimp, sea bass and oysters. Leonardo says that his work is according to the tides and this is why he lives near the beach. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy nets and other tools in order to become independent as his dream for the future is to begin the construction of his home.

loans.use: to buy nets and other tools

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 58 years old, married, and has no children.

Ahmad has owned a food market since 2011, selling soft drinks, juice, groceries, cheese, dairy products, and frozen beef, chicken, and fish. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good understanding of local customers, and knows his customers' needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy a small generator and renovate his shop. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and renovate his shop.

loans.name: Laura Elizabeth

texts.es: Laura vive en las Orquídeas al norte de Guayaquil. Tiene 51 años y está casada con Antonio quien se chofer profesional, juntos tienen 4 hijos pero 3 son mayores de edad solo la menor vive con ellos. Ella tiene una despensa en su domicilio en la que vende productos de primera necesidad para el hogar. El negocio lo empezó hace 19 años cuando tuvo una separación de su esposo, al no trabajar necesitaba dinero para la mantención de sus hijos. Inicio con algo pequeño pero poco a poco empezó a reunir dinero y fue ampliando la despensa. También vende comidas de rápida preparación la cual tiene mucha acogida. En un principio ambos negocios se le complicaron ya que no tenía conocimiento de ello pero fue aprendiendo y ahora es una excelente negociante. Gracias a Dios vio el fruto de sus esfuerzos ya que regreso con su esposo y mantiene su negocio a flote. Entre los productos que comercializa están los víveres, colas, lácteos, arroz, azúcar, harinas, panes etc. tiene de todo un poco para brindar variedad. El préstamo que solicita Laura es para la compra de productos esperando reunir el capital que necesita para terminar la construcción  de su casa.
texts.en: Laura lives in Las Orquídeas, north of Guayaquil. She's 51 years old and married to Antonio, who's a professional driver. Together they have four children, but three of them are adults and only the youngest one lives with them. She runs a grocery store from her home where she sells essential household goods. The business started 19 years ago, when she separated from her husband and, since she didn't work, she needed money to support her children. She started out small, but little by little she began saving up money and expanding the store. She also sells fast food which is very well-received. In the beginning there were complications in both businesses, because she wasn't familiar with them, but gradually she learned and now she's an excellent businesswoman. Thank God she saw the results from her efforts, since she got back together with her husband and she keeps her business afloat. Among the merchandise she sells are provisions, soft drinks, dairy, rice, sugar, flour, bread, etc. - a little of everything, so she can provide variety. The loan that Laura requests is for purchasing goods in hopes of saving the capital she needs to finish building her house.

loans.use: to purchase provisions, soft drinks, dairy, rice, sugar and flour.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hugo Eduardo

texts.es: Hugo Herrera vive en Milagros donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes, está casado con Maria quien es ama de casa y le ayuda en el negocio cuando no se encuentra. Hace 10 años que inicio el negocio con un capital que tenía reunido, empezó comprando una percha y productos de fácil comercialización para empezar con buen pie. En la actualidad tiene una tienda surtida donde vende colas, agua, víveres, azúcar, arroz etc., abre desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche sin cerrar ya que alterna la atención con su esposa cuando sale a comprar la mercadería. A sus 51 años Hugo se siente muy satisfecho con su negocio ya que no se siente como una carga para sus hijos y puede aportar en la economía de su hogar. Con el crédito que solicita el desea comprar productos para surtir el negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. espera a futuro continuar siendo una familia unida y pñder seguir trabajando sin problemas.
texts.en:
Hugo lives in Milagros where he has a grocery store. He is married to Maria who is a housewife and helps in the business when he can't be there. Some 10 years ago, Hugo began his business with capital he had put together. He started by buying a clothes rack and products that were easy to sell, in order to begin on a good footing.

At present, Hugo has a variety store where he sells colas, water, groceries, sugar, rice, etc. It remains open from 8:00 am until 8:00 pm without closing, and he alternates with his wife who tends the store when he goes out to purchase merchandise. At the age of 51, Hugo feels very satisfied with his business; it is not a burden on his children and it supports the household economy.

With the requested loan, Hugo wishes to buy products to stock the store and offer his customers better service. His hopes for the future are to continue as a united family and to keep on working without problems.

loans.use: to buy colas, water, groceries, sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Los Ceibos Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los Ceibos está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Darling quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 4 años la cual inicio con media docena de pantalones y camisas. Ella tiene un niño de 5 años el cual la motiva salir adelante.
Las otras integrantes son Roxana del Carmen quien vende ropa íntima y perfumes, y Jenny quien tiene una tortillería desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The group Los Ceibos consists of three hardworking entrepreneurs. One of them is Darling who has been selling clothing for four years, and she started out with a half a dozen pants and blouses. She has a five year old son which is her motive to get ahead.

The other members are Roxana del Carmen who sells lingerie and perfumes, and Jenny who has had a tortilla stand for six years.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en:
Korpo lives in the Airport Community. She is 29 years old and married with three children between 4 and 9 years old who are in school and live at home. Her husband works at the Robert International Airport.

For the past eighteen years she has been selling palm oil in the market. Korpo says she received a little amount from her sister to be involved in the business. She enjoys her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. 

She is planning to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Bahromjon

texts.en: Bahromjon is a person who decides on his plan at once. For more than three years now, Bahromjon has been working at TALKO. He is one of the best workers, working hard from early morning till late evening. He has a bachelor's degree and always tries to increase his level of knowledge. Bahromjon loves small children very much, and has five children. His wife doesn’t work outside the home because she is busy raising their children. Bahromjon wants to repair his house with modern planning, so he is asking for a loan to buy building materials. Bahromjon awaits your help.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice lives in the airport community. She is 49 years old and married, with five children between 22 and 31 years old. For the past twenty years she has been selling charcoal in her community. Alice says she spends most of her time with her business, which she started with money given to her by her husband. Since her business helps to sustain her family, she is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. Her plans are to build a house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: De Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los Ángeles lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Jaqueline de 26 años quien inicio hace cinco años con el comercio de ropa y cosméticos con las ganancias hace 2 años que instalo una pequeña pulpería negocio en que invertirá el crédito. Ella está casada y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 2 años.
Las otras integrantes son Sonia del Carmen quien se dedica al comercio de productos Avon desde hace 4 años y María Luisa de 25 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, gaseosa y cervezas desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The group Los Ángeles consists of three hardworking entrepreneurs. One of them is Jaqueline who is 26 years old. Five years ago she began selling clothing and cosmetics. Two years ago with the earnings she set up a little grocery store and she will use the money from the loan to invest in it. She is married and has two children who are 6 and 2 years old.

The other members are Sonia del Carmen who has been selling Avon products for 4 years, and María Luisa who 25 years old and who has been selling clothing, soft drinks and beer for 3 years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains

loans.name: Eva R.

texts.en: Eva R. is 45 years old and lives in the Airport community.  She is married with five children aged 15 to 26  that live at home and attend school. For the past eleven years she been selling used clothes. Eva R. started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes her business because it keeps her saving every day. Her plan is to build a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to enable her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan is a 46-year-old man who owns his own café. He is married and has two children. His son and wife help him run the business. He is a professional cook and makes delicious beef and lamb kababs. He also serves customers different national dishes like dolma, pilov, and dovga soup. His café is always full, especially during lunch and dinner time. Rovshan is proud that his café is so popular: this business brings him 200 AZN income per month. Now he would like to expand his business and improve the condition of his café. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy new furniture and renovate. This will be his third loan, and Rovshan has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and renovate.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina  es conviviente, tiene 41 años de edad  actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” grupo  conformado por 5  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.  Cristina  trabaja desde hace 10  años en la venta de plástico, gas y carbón , trabaja en el mercado de su distrito este trabajo surge por que a sus esposo no le alcanzaba el sueldo para mantener a sus tres hijos es asi que cristina trabajo muy duro para sacar a su familia adelante, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación   a logrado mejores ingresos y su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida . Cristina   ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercaderia plástico, gas y carbón   . Cristina cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en: Cristina is in a common law marriage. She's 41 years old and currently a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras" ("Enterprising Women"), a group comprised of five members who are in various trading businesses. Cristina has been selling plastic, gas and charcoal for the past 10 years. She works in the market of her district. She started out in this line of work because her husband's wages weren't enough to support their three children, and that's why Cristina has worked so hard in order to get her family ahead. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has been able to improve her income and her family's living conditions. Cristina has requested a new loan in order to purchase merchandise - plastic, gas and charcoal. Cristina will achieve her goals with a lot of hard work and effort, and the loans from Edaprospo will be of help.

loans.use: to purchase plastic, gas and charcoal.

loans.name: Seata

texts.en:
Seata, 37 years old, lives in the community of Airport. She has five children aged between 4 and 18 years old, all in school and living at home. Seata stopped her education in the 9th grade.

Seata started her charcoal business in 2000 with money given to her by her husband. She has continued to make more profit and have more customers. With additional loans, Seata will expand her business and send her children to school until they are out of high school. Seata is requesting this loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She hopes to have a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en:
Kebbeh, 28 years old, lives in the community of Airport. She is married and has four children aged between 2 and 12 years old, all in school and living with her.

Kebbeh has been selling for the past 8 years. She currently sells cold water and drinks. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks and cold water for her business. She says that she started her business selling ice with credit, taking the goods, selling them, returning the principal and making a profit. Kebbeh's plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and cold water for her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 22 years old, single, and lives with six family members. 

Ali is a car mechanic who specializes in oil and filters. He established his business in 2011. He now has great experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and he knows his customers' needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting a youth loan of $1,800 to pay the annual rent for the shop. He plans to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married, and has five children.

Saad is a car mechanic. He has owned his business since 1992. He has great experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and he knows his customers' needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting a loan of $2,400 to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is planning to expand his business and increase his profits so that he can provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa lives in the Airport Community. She is 40 years old. She is married with three children between 13 and 20 years old who are in school and live at home. 

For the past ten years, she has been selling rice by the bag in her community. Theresa says she spends most of her time with her business since her business is in her community. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. The problem she faces is the transportation cost.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice for her business. 

Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice for her business.

loans.name: Maytham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old and married but still doesn’t have any children.

Maytham owns a shop for repairing computers, laptops, and mobiles. He is been in this business since 2010. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2,400 to renovate the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Guandugloma  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Guandugloma está formado por 8 socias, quienes viven por el cantón Nabón, lugar de clima frió, está rodeado por una exuberante vegetación y en este lugar se puede respirar la tranquilidad del campo. Su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen su vestimenta, tradiciones y cultura de sus pueblos, se dedican a labrar los campos, a la cría de animales y muchos en especial los jóvenes salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades económicas. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Dolores, tiene 41 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 16, 14, 11, 8, 7, 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y tres de sus hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es de profesión albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad. 

Doña María Dolores se dedica en los quehaceres de su hogar, cría y vende ganado, cuyes, credos, borregos y gallinas y también labora en la agricultura cultivando sus terrenos, sus cosechas son para el consumo de su hogar y para la vende.
 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus terrenos, cuyes, gallinas y cerdos. 

Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Guandugloma consists of 8 members who live in the canton of Nabón, a place with a cold climate, surrounded by abundant vegetation and in this place you can breathe the tranquility of the countryside.

Its people are kind, gentle and still maintain the dress, traditions and culture of their people. They work in the fields, raising animals and many, especially the young people, go to the city to work every day in different economic activities.

One of the members of this group is María Dolores. She is 41 years old, married and from this marriage she has 6 children who are 16, 14, 11, 8, 7, and 2 years old. Her first two children are studying at school and three of her children are studying at a little local school. Her husband is a bricklayer. They own the house they live in.

María does the household chores, raises and sells cattle, guinea pigs, pigs, sheep and chickens and she also works in agriculture cultivating their land. The crops are for their household consumption and to sell.

This is the second loan they have made in the communal bank and it will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer for the land, guinea pigs, chickens and pigs. Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, guinea pigs, chickens and pigs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 31 years old, lives in the community of Airport. She is married and has three children aged between 4 and 20 years old, all in school and living at home.

For the past nineteen years, Rebecca has been selling palm oil and dried meat in the market. She enjoys the way customers respond to her business. Rebecca is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and dried meat for her business. Her plan is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and dried meat for her business

loans.name: Islom

texts.en: Islom is an effective businessman. For14 years, he has worked selling carpets and household goods. His aim is to realize all of his dreams. His experience helps him to be the best in business amongst his colleagues. Islom nowadays has a big assortment, which is why he has many customers. Islom is as good in business as in family. He has a friendly family and he concentrates on doing his best for them because he loves his family very much. Islom wants to develop his business and in this way help others. Islom is asking for a loan to buy goods to expand his business. He is awaiting your help.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jartu

texts.en: Jartu, 32 years old, lives in the community of Airport. She is married and has two children aged 8 and 13. Jartu stopped her education in the 8th grade. For the past 15 years she has been selling charcoal and palm oil in her community market. Jartu says she spends most of her time with her business since it helps to sustain her family. She started this business with money given to her by her mother at a time when her husband was not working, He currently works as a carpenter. Jartu is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal and palm oil for her business. Their plans are to build a house and buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Carmen Paulina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos como los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para su esposo el cual tiene un pequeño camión en el cual realiza fletes a ciertas empresas atuneras en la ciudad de Manta, nos cuenta que su esposo realiza de tres a cuatro viajes por semana hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil lugar donde recibe la carga de embases para atunes, los mismos que luego los transporta hasta las empresas atuneras en Manta, por lo cual le pagan muy bien, él lleva más de 15 años dedicado a esta labor la cual les ha permitido salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar ciertos repuestos que necesita el carro y combustibles. Lleva más de 7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es comprar un camión nuevo.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its diversity of local products such as Panama hats and shawls known inside and outside the country, the members of the Banco Comunal Mujeres Por el Progreso meet twice a month.

In this place we meet Carmen, who is 49 years old, married and they have 5 children, all adults, two of them still living with her. Her husband is a driver.

Our friend is asking for a loan for her husband who has a small truck which he uses to transport freight to various tuna companies in the city of Manta. She tells us that her husband makes three or four trips per week to the city of Guayaquil, where he receives a load of tuna containers, which he then takes to the tuna businesses in Manta, for which he is paid very well. He has been doing this work for more than 15 years which has permitted him to get ahead.

This loan is to buy certain spare parts needed for the truck and fuel. She has been with the communal bank for more than 7 years and she likes it for the support they give with their loans.

Her dream is to buy a new truck.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and fuel

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel, 33 years old, lives in Buchanan. She is married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 15, all in school and living at home. Her husband works with the road contractor company.

Rachel has been operating a beauty salon for the past 9 years. She learned the business from her mother and started it with money given to her by her mother. Rachel is requesting a loan to purchase more hair spray, grease and artificial hair for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more hair spray, grease and artificial hair for her business

loans.name: Alianza Unida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Alianza Unida está formado por 11 socias quienes laboran en diferentes actividades, las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares, tener dependencia económica y sacar adelante a sus familias, se caracterizan por ser mujeres amables, gentiles y de un gran carisma, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Nuestra socias viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es una de las más importantes del país, es desde Diciembre 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, siendo nombrada por la gran riqueza arquitectónica y cultural, también cuenta con vario lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Sra. Vilma, tiene 40 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 21, 19 y 14 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan para sus gastos personales y su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial y labora en su taller propio, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
  
Nuestra socia labora como empleada privada desde hace 12 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo en horarios rotativos.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir comprando víveres para su hogar y materiales de construcción para hacer algunos arreglos en su casa.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa. 

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Alianza Unida communal bank is made up of 11 members working in different businesses which helps them cover household expenses, have economic independence and get their families ahead.  These women are friendly, gentile, have great charisma, and maintain the culture and traditions of their people.  Our members live in different places in Cuenca, one of the most important cities in the country.  In 1999 Cuenca was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its architectural richness and culture and also for its many places to enjoy natural beauty.

One of the members is Vilma, 40, married and with  3 children, 21, 19 and 14.  The oldest two work and pay for their own expenses and her youngest son is in school in the city.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic who works in his own shop and they live in their own house.
