El grupo Génesis lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Eliezer quien se dedica a la venta de Sandalias desde hace 3 años  negocio en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de mercadería en calzado.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son Manfield quien vende bolsos y fajas y Xiomara quien comercializa cosméticos.
texts.en:
The loan group Génesis is comprised of 3 hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Eliezer, who has been selling sandals for 3 years. He will use the loan for this business and will buy supplies of shoes.
The other members of the group are Manfield, who sells bags and belts and Xiomara, who sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy supplies of shoes.

loans.name: Nancy Liliana

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya mayores de edad y uno de 12 años de edad que estudia en el colegio, tres de ellos aun viven con ella. El marido es empleado público.
 
Nuestra amiga para ganar algo por su cuenta realiza trabajos contables ya que tiene titulo de contadora y varias personas le pide que les realice estos trabajos contables, pero además de esto ella también confecciona ropa, nos cuenta que muchas personas acuden a su casa donde tiene un taller de costura y allí confecciona todo tipo de prendas de vestir pero agrega que lo que más confecciona es ropa femenina, ella lleva más de 10 años realizando estas labores que gracias a Dios le dejan buenos ingresos.

Este crédito es para comprar hilos, telas, cierres y varios materiales necesarios en la elaboración de las prendas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda el banco. 

Su sueños es ten es un taller más grande.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro meet every two weeks in the town of 30 de Septiembre in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious candy that the locals make and that is recognized throughout the country.
Nancy lives here. She is 45 years old and has a common law husband with whom she has 4 children. 3 of them are grown up and the 12 year old is in school. Three of them still live with her. Her husband is a public employee.
In order to earn something herself, our friend does accounting work and has the title Accountant and various people ask her to do accounting work. But, in addition to this, she makes clothes. She tells us that many people go to her house where she has a sewing workshop and she makes all sorts garments there, although mostly women's clothes. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years and, thanks be to God, it has brought her a good income.
This loan will be used to buy yarn, fabric, fastenings, and various materials necessary for making clothes. She has been with the community bank since it started and she likes the help that is offered.
Her goal is to have a bigger workshop.

loans.use: to buy yarn, fabrics, fasteners, and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Lucy Patricia

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lucy, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de  19, 18, 16 y 5 años  de edad,  los dos mayores esperan ingresar este año a la Universidad y los otros estudian en colegio y escuela, todos ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo tiene un taller de ebanistería.

Nuestra amiga es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al dia, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que parte del crédito también lo utiliza su esposo en su taller de ebanistería para comprar materia prima útiles en la elaboración de muebles y todo lo que él elabora con la madera.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y madera. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro' community bank meet in '30 de Septiembre' neighborhood, in Rocafuerte canton.  This area is known for the delicious sweet treats that are prepared by the locals.  They are well known throughout the country.

This is where we get to know Lucy.  Lucy is 41 years old, married, and has four children who are 19, 18, 16 and 5 years old.  Her two eldest hope to start university this year and the others are in high school and elementary school.  They all still live with her.  Her husband has a furniture workshop.

Our friend is a housewife who, in order to make her own money and help her husband with the household expenses, sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week, for two to three hours a day.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment once a week.  She has been in this business for four years and it is doing very well.  She tells us that her husband will use some of the loan money for his furniture workshop.  He will buy raw materials that he uses in making his furniture and everything else he makes from wood.

Lucy will use this loan to buy perfumes, cream, cosmetics and wood.  This is her fourth loan cycle as a member of this community bank and she likes it because the repayments are easy to make.

Lucy's dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and wood

loans.name: Lourdes Patricia

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lourdes, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 20 años de edad,  el cual aunque ya está comprometido  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga trabaja de maestra en una escuela de la localidad, pero además de esto ella también se dedica al comercio con la finalidad de ganar algo extra, ella tiene una carreta en la cual vende empanadas, deditos, tortillas, jugos, sodas, entre otras cosas, nos cuenta que en las mañanas es su marido el que se encarga del negocio pero ya en las tardes ella es quien con la ayuda de su marido trabajan pues en las tardes le llegan más clientes, trabajan desde las 6h00 hasta la 19h00, llevan más de 5 años con este negocio el cual les ha permitido salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar sodas, jugos preparados y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en sus clases y en su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro' community bank meet in '30 de Septiembre' neighborhood, in Rocafuerte canton.  This area is known for the delicious sweet treats that the locals prepare.  They are well known all over the country.

This is where we get to know Lourdes.  Lourdes is 41 years old, married, and has a 20-year-old son who is engaged but still lives with her.  Her husband works in commerce.

Our friend works as a teacher in an elementary school in the town.  In addition, she also works in commerce in order to earn some extra money.  She has a cart where she sells empanadas, 'deditos' (cheese fingers), tortillas, juice, soda and other products.  She tells us that her husband takes care of the business in the mornings but in the afternoons she and her husband both work because they have more customers then.  They work from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  They have been in this business for more than five years and the business has allowed them to get ahead in life.

This loan will be used to buy soda, prepared juices and supplies for preparing food.  This is Lourdes' fourth loan cycle as a member of this community bank and she likes it because the loans have very low interest rates.

Lourdes' dreams are to make progress in her classes and in her business.

loans.use: to buy soda, prepared juices and supplies for making food

loans.name: El Mamon Group

texts.es:
El grupo el mamón lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Filena quien tiene un taller de calzado desde hace 12 años. Ella primeramente trabajo durante años en taller de calzado y luego decidió iniciar con su propio taller junto con su esposo. El crédito invertirá en galleta, brazil, suela, pega, cartón…etc.
Ella logro con los créditos una de ellas es María Petrona quien tiene una pulpería e invertirá en granos básicos, gaseosas y pollo, y Modesta quien desde hace 15 años vende almohadas y cobertores.
texts.en:
The 'El Mamón' group is made up of three hard-working, entrepreneurial people.  One of them is Filena, who has had a shoe workshop for 12 years.  She used to work for years in a shoe workshop and then decided to set up her own workshop together with her husband.  She will invest her loan in buying soles, adhesive, cardboard, etc.  

The other members of this group are María Petrona, who has a grocery store and will invest in buying basic grains, sodas and chicken, and Modesta, who has been selling pillow cases and bedspreads for 15 years.

loans.use: to buy soles, adhesive, cardboard, etc.

loans.name: El Reencuentro  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Reencuentro está formado por 9 socias y 1 socio, quienes viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica del país, su riqueza natural y cultural la hacen una ciudad muy especial, la gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva a propios y extraños. Su gente es amable, gentil y de un carisma muy grande. Nuestras socias se caracterizan por ser mujeres muy trabajadoras, luchan a diario para mejorar la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nancy, tiene 45 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 18 y 13 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la Universidad y sus 2 últimos hijos estudian en el colegio. Su esposo labora prestando sus servicios como chofer, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros pero independientes.

Nuestra socia pasa la mayor de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de su hogar y para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar se dedica a cuidar niños por lo cual le pagan mensualmente, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años y  trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.

Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar y material didáctico para los niños que cuida.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.

La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The 'El Reencuentro' community bank is made up of nine women and one man who all live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This is the third most financially important city in the country.  Its natural and cultural wealth make it a very special city.  The cuisine is very wide ranging and delights both locals and visitors alike.  The people are friendly, kind and very charming.  Our members are noted as being very hard-working women who work hard every day in order to improve their households' financial status and provide for their families.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of this group is Nancy.  Nancy is 45 years old, married, and has three children who are 19, 18 and 13 years old.  Her eldest daughter is studying at University and her other two children are in high school.  Her husband works as a driver.  They do not own their own home.  They live in her in-laws' home but independently.

Our member spends most of her time at home taking care of her household.  In order to help with the household expenses, she looks after children, for which she is paid monthly.  She has been in this business for five years and works from Monday to Saturday, from 9.00am to 7.00pm.

This is Nancy's second loan as a member of her community bank.  She will invest it in buying food for her household and educational materials for the children that she cares for.

Nancy's dream is to own her own home.

The small photo is of two of the members who couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy food and educational materials

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto tiene 46 años, su pareja es Lucila, con quien tiene seis hijos. Todos ellos viven en una casita rústica que Ernesto construyó.
Él es un experto en las labores del campo, ya que lleva toda su vida en esta actividad. Siembra café en dos parcelas de terreno, plátanos y achiote en otra parcela, y otra para exclusivamente yucas. De esa manera puede surtir sus productos y ofrecerlos a los compradores que ya lo conocen por la calidad de sus frutos. Con la ayuda de Lucila y operarios que contrata puede abastecerse para atender todos sus cultivos. Uno de lo inconvenientes para realizar su trabajo es la distancia y el acceso de sus terrenos, por eso se levanta muy temprano para dirigirse a sus campos.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y afirma que su primera experiencia fue satisfactoria, por eso se compromete, una vez más, a pagar con puntualidad las mensualidades. Pertenece al banco comunal “Stonkiri de San Pablo”, donde sus compañeros son todos solidarios.
Con este dinero podrá comprar bolsas de abono para fertilizar sus terrenos de café.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 46 years old and his partner is Lucila, with whom he has six children. They all live together in a rustic little house that Ernesto built. He is an expert in farm work since he has spent his life in this occupation. He plants coffee in two parcels of land, plantains and achiote in another parcel and another parcel is exclusively for cassava. In this way, he can stock up his products and offer them to buyers that already know him for the quality of his produce.

With the help of Lucila and workers that he contracts, he can provide enough to attend to all of his products. One of the inconveniences to fulfilling his work is the distance and accessibility of his lands. As such, he wakes up very early to bring himself to the farm lands. 

This is his second loan with MFP and he affirms that his first experience was satisfactory. As such, he commits, once more, to making his monthly payments on time. He belongs to the communal bank "Stonkiri de San Pablo" where his partners are all supportive. With this money he will buy bags of fertilizer for his coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 24 años, su pareja es Honorio, con quien tiene tres hijos de 7, 3 y 1 año. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, siembra kión, plátanos, café, yuca y maíz. Lleva cerca de 7 años es esta labor a lado de su pareja, con quien sale a tempranas horas de la mañana hacia sus cultivos. “La venta es rentable de todos mis frutos, solo depende de cosecharlos a tiempo y saber a quién se va a vender”, menciona. Considera que uno de sus inconvenientes fue la falta de capital para invertir en la compra de semillas y abono para ampliar sus terrenos, por eso agradece el apoyo que ahora le brindan. Sus metas son claras, aumentar su producción de café y kión, pues son los productos que mayores ganancias le dan, para ello trabajará arduamente.

Este es el crédito número 2 que recibe de MFP, por eso da su palabra de pagar puntualmente como lo hizo en el anterior. Pertenece al banco comunal “Stonkiri de San Pablo”, de cuyos integrantes se siente satisfecha.
Con este dinero podrá compra semillas de maíz para iniciar una siembra. Así también pagará a los jornaleros quienes limpiarán la maleza del kión.
texts.en:
Luz is 24 years old. Her partner is Honorio, with whom she has three children of 7, 3 and 1 years of age. They live together in their own house located in an indigenous community. She makes a living in agriculture, planting ginger, plantains, coffee, cassava and corn. She has 7 years of experience working at her partner's side, with whom she leaves early in the morning for her crops.

"The sale of all my products is profitable, only dependent on harvesting them on time and knowing to whom I am going to sell", she mentions. She considers that one of her inconveniences was the lack of capital to invest in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer to expand her lands. As such, she is thankful of the support that is now brought to her. Her goals are clear, to increase her production of coffee and ginger, because they are the most profitable products, for which she will work hard.

This is her second loan that she has received from MFP. As such, she gives her word to pay on time, as she did with the previous loan. She belongs to the communal bank "Stonkiri de San Pablo", whose members feel satisfied. With this money  she will be able to buy corn seeds to initiate planting. She will also pay the laborers who will clean the undergrowth of the ginger.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay the laborers who work on her crops.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Gumercinda tiene 29 años, vive con el padre de sus dos hijos de 8 y 7 años en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa.
Tiene cinco parcelas de terreno en las que produce café, plátanos, yuca y maíz. Pero mayormente café, que vende a las cooperativas cafetaleras de la ciudad. La cosecha es todo un acontecimiento, primero tiene que seleccionar los granos más rojos y luego quitarles la pulpa y salvar las pepas o granos, después los hace secar para venderlos. Con el plátano, la yuca y el maíz la rutina es menor, pero igual de importante. Cuando el trabajo cesa, Gumercinda también labora en otras parcelas como jornalera. Por su parte, su esposo siempre la apoya en estas arduas labores. Ahora piensa sembrar más café, para ello invertirá en la compra de plantitas.

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por eso se siente agradecida con el apoyo brindado. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shatzoshis”, un grupo sólido y unido. 
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de bolsas de abono para sus nuevos cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Gumercinda is 29 years old.  She lives in her own home located in a native community with the father of her children whom are 8 and 7 years old.  She has five parcels of land in which she produces coffee, plantains, yucca, and corn. 

Her primary crop is coffee, which she sells to the cafes in the city.  The harvest is a process.  First, she must select the most red grains and then remove the pulp and save the seeds.  Then, she dries the grains so she can sell them.  In regards to the plantain, yucca, and corn, the process is less labor intensive but just as important.  

When there is no work to be done on the crops she also works as a laborer.  Her husband does his part in always helping her with the arduous labor.  Now, she is thinking of planting more coffee and will purchase more seedlings.  

This is her firth credit with MFP which is why she feels grateful for the support.  She belongs to the communal bank "Shatzoshis", a strong and unified group.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of fertilizer for her new coffee crops.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: Juan de Dios tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, su esposa se dedica  a los quehaceres del hogar, es una familia muy unida y trabajadora. Juan inicio su negocio con el cultivo de café pero con el tiempo bajo de precio y decidió cultivar maíz, frijoles y sandia, el oficio lo aprendió con la ayuda de amigos que se dedican al mismo rubro, el horario laboral es variable y lo hace en conjunto con sus empleados. Su ventaja es el buen clima que favorece a sus cultivos y por los problemas que enfrenta Juan es por las diferentes plagas que le causa daño a su cosecha, también le afecta en algunas ocasiones los bajos precios que le ofrecen por su producto. Juan solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de urea, en el arado de las tierras y el pago a sus empleados. Con la ayuda de este préstamo su vida cambiaria ya que podrá comprar todo lo que necesita para su cosecha y poder tener buenos cultivos de granos. Su meta es que su cosecha sea de calidad y productiva para que puedan crecer sus ingresos y que le ayuden con el sostenimiento de su familia. Juan de Dios ha sido cliente de FAMA por más de 3 ciclos y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Juan de Dios is 37 years old, married, and has three children.  His wife takes care of the household chores.  They are a very united and hard-working family.  Juan started out growing coffee but, over time, the price fell and he decided to start growing corn, beans and watermelon.  He learned the business with the help of some friends who are in the same line of work.  His working hours are variable and he works them out together with his employees.  Juan's advantage is the good climate that favors his crops.  The problem that he faces is the different pests that harm his harvests.  He is also sometimes negatively affected when he is offered low prices for his crops. 

Juan is requesting this loan to invest in buying urea.  He will also pay to plow his land and pay his workers.  With the help of this loan, his life will change as he will be able to buy everything he needs for his harvest and everything he needs to grow good crops.  His goal is for his harvest to be good quality and productive so that his income will rise and he will be able to support his family.  Juan de Dios has been a client of FAMA for three loan cycles and he repaid his previous loans on time.

loans.use: to buy urea, to pay to plow his land and to pay his workers

loans.name: Los Altos Iii Group

texts.es:
La señora Cristina Candelaria  está casada, tiene 21 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijos, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de cerdos, inició este negocio vendiendo pollos y gallinas y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un crédito para comprar cerdos y venderlos posteriormente, y así mejorar su negocio. Espera ella en el futuro tener más capital y más variedad en sus ventas. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales, cerdos, pavos, ganado, gallinas, pollos, y a la atención de tienda en general.
texts.en: Cristina Candelaria is 21 years old and married. She finished the 3 years of primary education and has one child. She raises and sells pigs. She has been in this business for 3 years, starting with chickens and hens. She puts together a group to ask for a loan in order to buy pigs and then sell them, and thus improve her business. Her hope for the future is to have more capital and more variety in what she sells. The other members of the group raise and sell animals (pigs, turkeys, cattle, hens, chickens), or tend to a shop.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.en:
Mayram runs two businesses: raising livestock and selling food products from her house. She is the mother of three children and always tries to find new sources of income to help support them. Mayram has a very kind husband who helps her in her work.

Mayram’s skills have brought her success in her businesses. Her aim is to widen the scope of her business ventures. With this loan, she intends to buy goods for developing her food sales business. She is grateful for your help.

loans.use: To buy goods for developing her business

loans.name: Srey Neang

texts.en:
Srey Neang, age 29, has worked in a garment factory for over seven years, earning approximately $4 per day. She and her husband have two children and live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

Her husband is a taxi driver who earns about $8 per day. Because the present car is old and in frequent need of repairs, Neang is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 in order to purchase a new car so that her husband can continue to run the taxi service. This purchase will help her husband attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a new car so that her husband can continue to run his taxi service

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Mrs Thanh, born in 1967, works as a manual laborer for a small company. She is divorced and is raising her two daughters on her own. She earns a salary of 2,000,000 VND. 

She has participated in the crediting program of SEDA since 2009. During the last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In the current loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND in order to buy chickens and pigs to raise in her garden. Raining livestock will allow her to earn more money per month. 

She hopes that this new venture will help her to be able to secure her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs to raise in her garden

loans.name: Victoire Ayélé's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Victoire Ayélé, la responsable, est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04  enfants tous scolarisés. Victoire Ayélé a une boutique où elle commercialise des pagnes, des mèches et des divers depuis 08 ans et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants, Victoire Ayélé a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Victoire Ayélé se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group of two people with joint liability. The group’s representative is Victoire Ayélé, age 51. She is a married mother of four children who all go to school. She is the lady on the left in the photo.

Victoire Ayélé has a shop where she has been selling pagnes, hair extensions and various other items for the past eight years. She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin. 

To meet customer demand and provide for her children’s needs, Victoire Ayélé is seeking a loan from Finadev.

loans.use: to buy one box of hair extensions, one carton of milk, one carton of sugar and five pagnes VLISCO.

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Thach is 47 years old. She is married and blessed with a son in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been weaving plastic baskets to sell for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about $5 per day. Her son is a construction worker. He earns about $4 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Thach is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase plastics to use for weaving baskets to sell. This money will help her expand her business and earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and rebuild her house to be more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase plastics to use for weaving baskets to sell.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon is 58 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a Khmer traditional doctor who earns about $5 per day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Mon is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase groceries to resell. By doing so, she would earn additional income to financially support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and build a new bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha was born in 1955. Her child is an adult. 

She is a farmer with an income of 1,000,000 VND per month. Her husband is a building worker. His earning is the main income of her family. It is about 3,000,000 VND. 

She has participated in the credit program of SEDA since 2007. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy chickens to resell them in the market.

loans.use: to buy chickens to resell them in the market.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is 50 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $9 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Keo is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service. This purchase will help her husband earn additional income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai was born in 1961. She has a child who is an adult. Her husband and she are farmers who grow rice and vegetables to gain 3,000,000 VND per month. 

She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy pigs and chickens to raise and sell.

Hoa is 36 years old. She has two children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Chamreourn

texts.en:
Chamreourn is 32 years old. She is married and blessed with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling vegetables for more than four years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband runs the motor-taxi service. He earns about $4 per day. 

Chamreourn wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Chamreourn is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Los Altos V Group

texts.es:
La señora Margarita está casada, tiene 46 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa de toda clase, inició este negocio gracias a la influencia de sus padre y hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería, playeras, suéteres, camisas, pantalones, etc. Espera en el futuro tener más capital  y un local establecido para la atención al público. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio de ropa, venta de cerdos, gallinas, carneros, carne y papas fritas.
texts.en:
Margarita is 46 years old, she is married and she has one child. She did not have the chance to study. She is a retailer selling all types of clothes. She was inspired by her father in starting this activity, and today she can count on 15 years of experience in this field. Her husband is a farmer and she can count on his support.

She has organized a group to request a loan that she will use to buy products such as T-shirts, sweaters, shirts and trousers. In the future she hopes to have more capital and a fixed locale to sell to the public. The other members of the group engage in selling clothes, pigs, chickens, sheep, meat and French fries.

loans.use: To buy T-shirts, sweaters, shirts and trousers.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира проживает в городе Исфара. Возраст 51 год. Замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Шоира вместе с мужем работает в аптеке. В этой области она 26 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимых препаратов.
texts.en:
Shoira lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. She's fifty-one years old, married and she has two children. Shoira runs a pharmacy with her husband and she's been in this business for 26 years. 
She's asking for a loan in order to purchase necessary supplies.

loans.use: to purchase necessary supplies.

loans.name: Hoshimjon

texts.en:
Hoshimjon has two children and a loving, caring wife. He is hardworking and a good family man.

From childhood he loved to make different objects of wood. As time passed, he kept up this hobby. He started by manufacturing cradles and beds. Then he decided to make other furniture. Slowly he became a professional. His friend and partner supports him in this business. Their business has been going successfully the last 14 years.

The purpose of his loan is to purchase equipment for cutting laminate. He hopes that you will support him in it, because he needs this machine.

loans.use: To purchase equipment.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 40 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband sells palm juice. He earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sok is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase farmland for cultivating rice. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her children earn higher educations.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites patiently performs her business daily in order to generate income for her family. She buys used bottles, scrap papers and other junk materials that she might get earnings from. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Marites is 41 years old, married and blessed with five children. Marites' husband is her partner in growing their business. Her husband is the one who drives their tricycle when buying junk materials. With her earnings from the business, Marites is able to provide her children allowances in school. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more junk materials from her customers and sell to junk shop. Marites wishes to maintain the business until her children finish their education.

loans.use: to buy more junk materials from her customers and sell to junk shop.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im is 46 years old. She is married and resides with her mother and five children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about $13 per day. One of her children is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Im is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work. This money will help her husband expand his business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn a higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work

loans.name: Soeurng

texts.en:
Soeurng is 30 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than 7 years, earning approximately 6 USD per day. Her husband runs the taxi service and earns about 6 USD per day. 

Because the present motorbike is old, Soeurng is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run the taxi service. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and help her children earn bachelor's degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run the taxi service

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en:
Kuch is 52 year old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been running a rubber plantation for more than two years, earning approximately 26 USD per day. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is a farm worker who earns about 4 USD per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Kuch is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase farmland for cultivating rice. By doing so, she would be able to generate additional income to support her family. In the future, she would like to run the pepper plantation and rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and provide better living condition for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for cultivating rice

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Chen is 41 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been running the services of grinding rice and fattening up pigs for more than a year, earning approximately 11 USD per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about 5 USD per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about 4 USD per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Chen is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland as well as for rental. This purchase would enable her to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to purchase rice to resell for a profitable price and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland as well as for rental

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Savy is 40 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved growing rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately 10 USD per day. Her husband is a teacher who earns about 3 USD per day. In order to improve her agricultural business, Savy is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase fertilizer, fuel and rice seeds to use in rice cultivation. In the future, she would like to raise fish to earn more income to support the family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, fuel and rice seeds to use in rice cultivation

loans.name: Keum Aun

texts.en:
Keum Aun is 28 years old. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about $5 per day.

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Keum Aun is requesting a loan of $900 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to be more convenient for her family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Alfredo Edmundo

texts.es: Alfredo vive en la Orquídeas donde tiene un taller de confección de ropa. A sus 49 años es viudo y sus hijos son mayores de edad. Vive en el sector norte conocido como Bastión Popular donde tiene su domicilio propio de cemento y cuenta con los servicios básicos. Hace 11 años inicio su taller de confección de ropa. Aprendió desde muy joven porque su mama se dedicaba a este negocio y fue ella quien le enseño corte. Se desempeño como su ayudante por varios años aprendiendo no solo la confección de las prendas sino también el trato a los clientes y proveedores. Pasando varios años se independizo al formar su familia empezando a ofrecer sus servicios con una maquina casera de coser. Poco  a poco se fue dando a conocer y ampliar el negocio realizando varios créditos para poder crecer. Actualmente tiene varias maquinas industriales y realiza confecciones por series, los pedidos se los hacen empresas y consisten en camisas tipo polo bordadas con el logotipo de la misma, pantalones unisex y chalecos este tipo de ropa es más fácil de confeccionar porque se realiza con medidas estándar. Trabaja de lunes a domingo cuando es necesario desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Mantiene un horario de trabajo porque tiene un grupo de personas que laboran para él. Se siente satisfecho ya que en estos años ha visto el crecimiento de su negocio hasta el punto de poder brindar trabajo a personas que lo necesitan. El mayor problema de Alfredo es enfermarse ya que el conoce todo su negocio y no tendría quien lo reemplace pero tiene fe en Dios que le brindara salud y fuerza necesaria para continuar. El préstamo que está solicitando lo empleara en la compra de mercadería como telas, hilos, botones y dinero para realizar reparaciones a sus maquinas.
texts.en: Alfredo lives in Orquídeas, where he has a tailoring workshop. At the age of 49, he is a widower and his children are grown. He lives in the northern sector known as Bastión Popular, where he has his own home made of cement, with basic utility services. He started his tailoring workshop 11 years ago. He learned the trade when he was very young, because his mother worked in this business, and it was she who taught him to make clothing. He worked as her assistant for a number of years, learning not only how to make clothing but also how to deal with customers and suppliers. After some years went by, he set up on his own when he started a family, starting by offering his services with a home sewing machine. Little by little, he became known in the area and expanded his business, taking out several loans so that he could grow. Currently, he has several industrial machines, and he has lines of clothing that he creates. His orders come from companies, consisting of polo shirts embroidered with the firm's logo, unisex trousers and vests. This type of clothing is easier to make, because it is created with standard measurements. He works from Monday through Sunday, when necessary, from 8 in the morning to 6 in the evening. He maintains fixed working hours because he has a group of people who work for him. He feels satisfied because in these years he has seen his business grow to the point of providing jobs for people who need them. Alfredo's greatest problem is getting ill, because he knows everything about his business and does not have someone to replace him. However, he says he has faith in God who will provide him with health and the strength he needs to continue. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy supplies such as fabrics, thread and buttons, and he will also use some of the funds to carry out repairs to his machines.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Rithy is 33 years old. He is a widower and is blessed with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is an arc welder who earns approximately $6 per day.

In order to improve his living’s finances, Rithy is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more steel to use in his business. This money will help him expand his business and earn more income for his living. In the future, he would like to expand his business and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more steel to use in his business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 23 years old. She is married and blessed with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Mom is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase farmland for cultivating rice. This purchase will help her generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop and send her child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for cultivating rice

loans.name: Ma. Leonora

texts.en:
Ma. Leonora is a widowed mother of five children, two of whom are married, while three are still single and working abroad. Through her hard work, faith in God and patience, she has been able to obtain life's greatest achievement, educating all of her children.

Her main product is rice, but because her daughter went abroad for better opportunities, Ma. Leonora took over her general store business last October. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy sacs of rice and groceries for the store. The loan will enable her to gain more profits and provide her customers with quality goods and friendly service.

Ma. Leonora believes that she will be a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy sacs of rice and groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor vive en Isla Trinitaria sector sur urbano de Guayaquil tiene una tienda y bazar el cual inicio hace 17 años atrás tiempo en el que empezó a vivir en este lugar. A inicios su negocio consistían en la venta de arroz y pollos a medida que fue ganando clientes empezó a surtir su negocio con diversos productos. Como había realizado una gran inversión se dedico a su negocio para poder ver crecimiento siendo así que ahora su tienda esta surtida y cuenta con gran cantidad de clientes. Ofrece productos como arroz, azúcar, pollo, carne, víveres, productos de limpieza, aceite, snacks etc. adicional a esto Victor también se dedica a la construcción y por eso es que la atención del negocio la realiza con sus esposa, así cuando él no se encuentra no existe problema que no lo pueda solucionar. Con el crédito compra mercadería para la tienda esperando que sus ventas crezcan para pagar puntual las cuotas y ahorrar para el arreglo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Victor lives in the Isla Trinitaria neighborhood in the south of Guayaquil.  He has a general store that he started 17 years ago, when he first came to live in this place.  At first, his business consisted of the sale of rice and chicken, through which he was gaining customers, so he started to stock his business with a variety of products.  As he had made a big investment, he dedicated himself to the business so he could see it grow.  Now his store is well-stocked and has a big customer base.  He offers products such as: rice, sugar, chicken, meat, groceries, cleaning products, cooking oil, snacks, and other products.  In addition to this business, Victor also works in construction.  For this reason, he shares running the store with his wife.  This way, when he is not around, there is no problem that can't be solved.  With this loan he will buy merchandise for his store, hoping that his sales will grow so that he can make his payments on time and save money to make repairs to his house.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, chicken, meat, groceries, cleaning products, cooking oil, snacks, and other products

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a woman talented in embroidery and sewing clothes. She started an embroidery business a few years ago to support her family financially.
She has sewn clothes with a sewing machine, but now her machine has started getting rusty because she has used it continually to sew cloth for so many years. 

Bushra requests a loan from Asasah, a Kiva field partner, because she wants to buy an electrical sewing machine so it won't get rusty and her work can run smoothly.

She has seven children, one daughter and six sons. They are continuing their education. 

After this loan, Bushra expects her business to expand more, so that she and her family can live happily.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
A 52-year-old married father of four, Virgilio's main priority is to educate his youngest child since his three other children are already married. The industrious and loving husband of Estrella, Virgilio is engaged in a livestock business that currently consists of one sow and six piglets. He also has a 1.3 hectare rice field and a 1.5 hectare corn field.

Determined to enable his youngest child to achieve a high level of education, Virgilio is now requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccine for his livestock. These purchases will ensure a good price when he sells, thus enabling him to improve their way of living and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccine for his livestock.

loans.name: Rocio Cecilia

texts.es: Roció tiene 35 años y vive en Playas con su familia. Está casada con Raul quien trabaja como digitador en una compañía, tienen 3 hijas dos de ellas asisten a la escuela fiscal y la menor de un año es su ayudante y aprendiz. Roció tiene un negocio muy particular por lo que tiene clientela, se dedica al lavado y secado de alfombras y tapices. El negocio lo empezó porque su padre desde hace 10 años tiene un negocio de lavandería pero solo de prendas de vestir, así fue como varios de ellos preguntaban si daban este servicio y nació la idea de empezarlo ella. Su jornada de trabajo empieza desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche y lo realiza ella, tanto la atención como la limpieza de las mismas. El trabajo lo realiza colocando la alfombra en un soporte de metal que mando a construir y empieza el lavado, si tiene manchas se rocía un limpiador directamente en la misma, luego de esto se utiliza la maquina limpiadora la cual tiene el depósito lleno con agua y shampu de alfombra, la maquina que se utiliza cuanta con cepillos rotatorios por debajo y es por esta agitación que el shampu penetra en las fibras retirando la suciedad, se realiza el proceso hasta que el agua del tanque no presente agua sucia. Roció que los precios por la limpieza varían según el tamaño de la alfombra pero generalmente cobra  $10.00 y por muebles $ 15.00. Con el préstamo que solicita comprara una maquina aspiradora, su sueño es a futuro dar servicio a empresas industriales y tener un furgón.
texts.en:
Rocio is 35 years old and lives in Playas with her family. She is married to Raul who works for a company as a digitizer. They have 3 children, 2 of whom attend public school, and the youngest by a year is her helper and apprentice.

Rocio has a very unusual business with the required clientele; she washes and dries carpets and upholstery. She began the business when her father operated a laundry some 10 years ago but only for clothing. Various customers asked whether this service was available and that gave birth to the idea.

Rocio's work day is from 9:00 am until 8:00 pm and she takes care of both customer service and the cleaning. The work is done by hanging the carpet over a metal support she had built and then she begins washing. If there are stains, Rocio applies a cleaner directly to them. Then she utilizes a cleaning machine whose tank is filled with water and carpet shampoo. The machine has rotating brushes at the base which when agitated, make the shampoo penetrate the fibers, washing out the dirt. She continues this until the water in the tank is no longer dirty.

Rocio says prices for cleaning vary according to carpet size but generally, she collects $10.00, and for upholstery $15.00. With the loan she is requesting, Rocio will buy an [industrial] vacuum cleaner. Her dream is to offer services to industrial enterprises in the future and to have a delivery van.

loans.use: purchase an industrial vacuum cleaner.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria José con solo 23 años tiene una tienda ubicada en su domicilio en la ciudad de Quevedo. Como es soltera vive con sus padres ya que está estudiando la universidad. El negocio lo inicio con un capital que le dio su papa el cual decidió invertir comprando productos de confitería, luego estudiando su barrio ofreció del servicio de recargas celulares. Pasando un tiempo y viendo que le estaba resultado el negocio sus padres la apoyaron para abrir un local en la parte delantera de la casa. Ahora en su negocio ofrece papelería, jugos, artículos de bazar etc. siente que a su edad va por buen camino manteniendo un negocio estable el cual le ayuda en sus gastos universitarios. De momento no tiene pensado casarse ya que desea terminar la universidad y el tiempo libre lo ocupa en la atención del negocio. Abre desde las 7 de mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y su hermana le ayuda en el horario de la tarde. Maria José va a solicitar el primer crédito en su vida y tiene la seguridad de que cancelara puntual sus cuotas. A tomado esta decisión con el fin de incrementar su negocio para poder a futuro poner un cyber.
texts.en: Maria Jose, who is only 23, has a store located in her home in the city of Quevedo.  As she is single, she lives with her parents.  She is already studying at the university.  She started this store with some capital that her father gave her, and she decided to invest it buying confectionery products.  Later, studying her neighborhood, she started offering cellular re-charge services.  After some time, and seeing that her business was getting good results, her parents supported her in opening up a store in front of the house.  Now her business sells stationery goods, juices, and general merchandise.  She feels that at her age, she is on a good path to keep her business stable, which is helping her pay for her university expenses.  At this time she has no plans to get married, because she wants to finish at the university, and she spends her free time working in the business.  Her store is open from 7am until 7 in the evening, and her sister helps her during the afternoon hours.  Maria Jose is requesting a loan for the first time in her life, and she is certain she can make her payments on time.  She has taken this decision with the goal of expanding her business, so that in the future she can add an internet station to her store.

loans.use: to buy stationery items, juices, general merchandise and sweets

loans.name: Oliya

texts.en:
Oliya is an excellent business woman because she has more than 18 years of experience selling food products. During the past 18 years, her business has developed step by step. Now Oliya has a successful business. 

She has a friendly family, but her husband doesn’t help her because he has gone to a foreign country to look for work. Oliya's cousin helps her in her business. He is a smart and clever young man. 

Oliya wants to widen the assortment of goods she carries, so she is asking for a loan to buy goods. She awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy a wider assortment of goods for her market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her family's livestock and dairy business.

loans.name: Dau's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dau was born in 1963. She has two children who are learning at secondary school. Her husband is a fisherman. His income is 2,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month. 

Mrs Dau has a vegetabls stall in the market. She gets 3,000,000 VND a month. The total income of her family is 5,000,000 VND. She has participated in the crediting program of SEDA since 2009. The last loan cycle, she borrowed 4,142,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND within 50 to enlarge her stall and buy more vegetables to sell. Then she hopes that the benefit of this stall would be able to let her children go to school.

About the other group members: Mrs. Loan is 48 years old. She has three children. She is a seafood seller. She want to borrow 6,322,000 VND to support for her seafood selling stall. Mrs Huong is 42 years old. She has two children. She is a mechanical plating painter. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more materials for her plating job.

loans.use: to enlarge her stall and buy more vegetables to sell. Then she hopes that the benefit of this stall would be able to let her children go to school.

loans.name: Sakoma

texts.fr: Sakoma est un homme celibataire de 37 ans sans enfant, mais il a une personne a sa charge. Il a ouvert une alimentation pres de son domicile qu'il gere depuis 11 ans deja. Son petit commerce fonctionne grace a longue experience dans ce domaine et la clientele qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Il solicite ce credit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (avec de l'eau minerale,cartons de sucres, des friandise,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Sakoma réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sakoma, age 37, is single with no children but he does support one person. He opened a grocery store near his home 11 years ago. His small business is running smoothly thanks to his vast experience in this activity and to his growing customer base. 

He is seeking this loan to strengthen his working capital. He will diversify his merchandise (mineral water, sugar, sweets, etc.), and hopefully raise his profit margin. 

Sakoma plans to reinvest part of his profits in his activity to meet the needs of his clientele, while the other portion will be used to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy cartons of sugar and pallets of mineral water.

loans.name: Diu

texts.en:
Diu was born in 1949. She has three children. Her two daughters got married; her son is a driver. Her husband retired. His pension is 1,000,000 VND. 

Diu sells chicken eggs for a living. She earns 3,000,000 VND a month from her egg selling. She has taken part in SEDA's credit program since 2007. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,758,000 VND, and she repaid that loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more eggs to sell

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Soi

texts.en: Soi was born in 1962. Her husband is a construction worker. He gets 3,000,000 VND each month. Her three children are all adults. Her son works for BTLong industrial park. Soi sells vegetables for a living. The total income of her family is 8,000,000 VND. She has participated in the credit program of SEDA since 2008. In the last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to enlarge her vegetable stall.

loans.use: to enlarge her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Crispiniano

texts.en:
Crispiniano is a father of three children who are currently studying. He dreams of having professional children, so he pursues his farming business. 

The truth is, he is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 as additional working capital. Due to the continuous high cost of commodities and farm inputs, he needs to ask for assistance through ASKI. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and insecticides. He promises to use the loan wisely in order to promote his children’s education as well as their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 24 years old. She is married and lives with her mother and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning about $6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Ny is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a walking tractor with a trailer to run the business of transporting palm leaves to sell, as well as a tilling service. This purchase will help her generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house so she can live separately from her mother.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor with a trailer to run the business of transporting palm leaves to sell, as well as a tilling service.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en: Malika as young and active person 19 years ago began own business with those money that she had. Malika sells oil of cotton and oil of another kind of plants. In a local market she has selling place and a lot of consumers. The business helps to Malika for keeping her family. She has a child and love him very much. Her husband is pensioner but works as a master of repairing of telephone. His income doesn’t enough for helping to his wife and that’s why Malika wants to take a loan to buy goods for developing her business. She waits your help.

loans.use: To buy goods for developing her business

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly was born in 1965. She lives in Van thuong village. She has three children: two daughters and a son. Two daughters were married. Her husband is a driver. He has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). Ly’s main job is farming. She raises chickens. She has participated in SEDA since 2006. The last cycle, she borrowed 9.374.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9.810.000 VND to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for chicken

loans.name: Merikebu Group

texts.en:
Pilly, who is in her mid 40s is married with three children who go to school.  She has been running a clothes shop for six years now.  She works from 8.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in the shop, household expenses and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell.  Her dream is to one day fulfill her dream of building a house as she saves all her profits in the back.

Pilly, will share this loan with her loan group "Merikebu" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Chan Marika

texts.en: Chan Marika is 32 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than four years, earning approximately $7 per day. Her husband is a teacher who earns about $3 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Chan Marika is requesting a loan of $1500 to raise capital in her business to purchase more groceries to resell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her groceries store and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Saron is 32 years old. She is widowed, resides with her father and a child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her father is a rice farmer who earns about $3 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Saron is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating rice. This money will help her expand her farming business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her child earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for cultivating rice

loans.name: Sok Nim

texts.en: Sok Nim is 28 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sok Nim is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to run the business of purchasing junk materials to resell. By doing so, she would earn additional income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to run the business of purchasing junk materials to resell

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura has more skills in business. She is business woman more than 7 years. Manzura sells women and men's clothing.  She has big assortment and it slightly attracts a lot of consumers. All of her efforts are to be successful in business and to get more money for keeping her family. She is married and has 4 children. Manzura’s husband helps in business to her. She wants to develop her business. She is asking a loan to buy goods for new season. She is waiting your help.

loans.use: To buy goods for new season

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is 41 years of age, married and has 5 children. Her eldest son works while living at home.
Perveen does embroidery, She is expert in her work and does beautiful embroidery on clothes for her clients.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her business. with the loan investment she will buy embroidery material like beads, thread, embroidery frames in bulk quantity that will help her fulfilling the client orders on time and increase her income.
She has been operating her business for the past many years and confident about her business success after investing the loan.
Note:"In the photo the lady raising her hand is Perveen."

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Theng is 48 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been producing souvenirs to sell for more than four years, earning approximately $1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. Two of her children are employed in garment factory. They earn about $6 per day. Theng is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase cements and bricks to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase cement and brick to rebuild her house

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: The keeping of live-stocks is the business of very kind and clever man by name Mahmud. Mahmud is a man who likes to work hard. During 4 years he is busy with selling of live-stocks. He tries to do his work perfectly because it is the main way of finding money. Mahmud is married and has 4 children. His children are as smart and hard-working as their father. They want to be a perfect business man as their father. Mahmud tries to develop his business. He is asking a loan to buy live-stock for widening her business. He waits your help.

loans.use: To buy live-stock for developing his business

loans.name: Sanobar's Group

texts.en:
Sanobar is very efficient and active lady. She remains at home and does her household responsibilities.
Her husband has a livestock business and sells cow milk to his community clients.
Sanobar provides full support to her husband in his business by taking care of the animals.
She has given birth to two children. both of them are very young and not of school going age yet.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan investment he will buy another dairy cow. This will help him getting larger quantity of milk for selling.
Note:"In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Sanobar."

loans.use: To buy dairy cow for livestock and dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a cart for his wife's business.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira is a woman who likes to work hard. She has own business more than 15 years. She is busy with making national ‘kurpacha’ (kurpacha is a seat of tajik people made from different kinds of cloth and cotton).She sells it in the local market. Munira has ‘golden hands,’ she prepares wonderful products which is useful for housing. Munira is widow and brings up her child alone. She wants to develop her business to do higher the level of their life. She is asking a loan to buy cloth for producing curpacha. She would be lucky if you help to her.

loans.use: To buy cloth for developing producing

loans.name: Sufiya

texts.en: Sufiya is a woman who plans ahead for all her deals. Syfiya 10 years ago planed to found own business. As she is very clever woman her business had developed year by year. Nowadays she is successful business lady. She sells clothing in the local market. She has own selling place. Most of her consumers are glad from Sufiya’s work. She has very wide assortment. Her aim is to get more high level in business. Sufiya is also a good mother and a lovely wife. Her husband is a driver and his income doesn’t enough to help Sufiya. That’s why she needs your help. If you help her with money she would be buying goods for new season.

loans.use: To buy goods for new season

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Yasin, who is in his early 30s is married with two children who go to school.  He has two businesses a Retail shop, fruits and vegetables since 2004.  He works from 6.00 am to 9.30 pm daily and is able to make s good monthly profit.

This will be his 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to restock the missing items in the retail shop, started fruits and vegetable business,bought a TV set, a Radio, DVD deck, paid school fees and has started building his house.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to increase on the Retail inventory and increase on the fruits & Vegetables stock to resell. His dream is to one day be able to finish building his house.

Yasin, will share this loan with his loan group "Molela" which has a total of 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the Retail inventory and increase on the fruits & Vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Africa  One Group

texts.en:
Harriet, who is in her late 30s is married with six children who go to school. She has been having two businesses, selling broiler chicken and goats selling since 2000.  She works from 9.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans for increasing on poultry and goats stock to resell, household expenses,paid school fees and has paid  back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan more buy chicks and chicken feeds. Her dream is to one day be able to manage paying her children's school fees and to build her own house.

Harriet, will share this loan with her loan group "Africa One"  which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a conservative person, for that she has asked one of her brothers to take her place in the photo.
Fadia, 29 years old single lady, she has four brothers and one sister living with their mother after their father passed away.
Fadia is a teacher at day time, at home she has a number of goats in a barn next to her house. Fadia uses those goats to take milk of them and make yogurt and cheese for sales.
Now Fadia has applied to the youth loan in order to increase the number of goats and sheep she has to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to increase the number of goats and sheep

loans.name: Monjed

texts.en:
Monjed, 31 years old married man.
Monjed has a workshop for making swings and pick up shaders, he has the fabric and the machines for that. It has been three years since he started his business and its going on well, now Monjed has applied to this loan to buy another machine to expand his market area.

loans.use: to buy another machine to expand his market area.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Using the previous loan has help Fatima and her husband add in more food products to their store. This time Fatmeh decided to let her husband be in the photo instead of her.
Now Fatima has applied to this loan in order to work with her husband in expanding the internal space of the store to include more products and get more customers.

loans.use: to expand the internal space of the store

loans.name: Nuhaila

texts.en:
Nuhaila has used the first loan to participate in some of the local exhibition for crafts, she also started making new items from straws as shown in the picture.
Although she wanted to concentrate on her crafts business, she recently has added selling cosmetic and make up products on the side to her business to attract more customer to her place.
Now Nuhaila has applied to this loan to bring in more straw and make bigger items like center tables and frames.

loans.use: to bring in more straw and make bigger items

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene and her family's lives are less fortunate. They live in Estefania. Mylene is 28 years old, has one child and is married to Vincent, a farmer. To help her spouse generate an income, she raises hogs and resells them for profits. She has been doing this for over five years now. 

She would like to further develop her hog-raising business; that is why she is borrowing a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed, vaccines and medicines for the sustainability of the hogs. This will help ensure healthier hogs to raise and sell in the future.

With her determined heart and hard work, Mylene is confident enough to achieve a fortunate life someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and medicines for the sustainability of the hogs.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar, 50 years old private sector retirement employee, after her husband retired from the military he started working as a guard to be able to support his family of four sons and a married daughter.
Samar also wanted to participate in the family’s income source, so she opened a small food store in the neighborhood where there no one else except hers. One of Samar’s sons change shifts with her when she gets tired.
Since there is no other stores nearby, Samar wants to include as much variety of product as she can, so she has applied to this loan to bring in more food products.

loans.use: to bring in more food products.

loans.name: Nehad

texts.en:
Nehad, 35 years old married woman, her husband owns a fruits and vegetables shop.
On the other hand, Nehad goes to wholesale markets and free zone areas to bring in some goods for sale, she started the business with buying and selling blankets and clothes, in the future she want to include more home products. 
She has applied to this loan to bring in more clothing goods to increase her revenue.
In the future Nehad wants to open a special place for the business where she can employee few females from the neighborhood to help improving the living conditions of their families.

loans.use: to bring in more clothing goods

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba, 23 years old married lady, her husband is a driver for a private company.
Heba want to help her husband in building a strong financially base for their family. By taking few courses in hair styles and make up, Heba started her home beauty salon where she bought a hair dryer with its tools and started working at home where her customers are her neighbors, friends and family for now.
Heba has applied to this youth loan to buy a new hair dryer, and curly tool and more tools to start going to others houses by order to do their hair. In the future she hopes to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy a new hair dryer, and curly tool

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en:
Arwa, 33 years old married woman, her husband works as a construction worker to support four children.
As a help to her husband Arwa started selling snacks and juices at home where most of buyers are kids in the same age of her children. 
Now Arwa has applied to this loan to bring in more chocolate and lollipops for the kids to sell, in hopes in the future she can find a place for her to expand and turn her business into a food store.

loans.use: to bring in more chocolate and lollipops

loans.name: Malika

texts.en: Malika, 20 years old married lady, she is a student who goes to the university to study student guidance and psychology. She is now in her second year and is eager to continue to get her degree and start applying to work at schools. But for now she has applied to this educational loan in order to pay for her third year’s fees.

loans.use: to pay for her third year’s fees

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en:
Afaf, is a conservative person. She has asked her son Thaer to take her place in the photo.
Afaf is a 54 years old housewife caring for two sons and two daughters, one of her sons is Thaer who is a university student, she has applied to this loan in order to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad, a 23-year-old single man, has eight brothers and sisters; two of them are older than him. Such a big family is a huge financial burden for their parents, so Mohammad has decided to take out this loan to pay for his semester fees until he graduates and starts making his own money, which he can use to help his family.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a conservative person, so she has asked her husband to take her place in the photo. 

Wafaa is a 37-year-old married woman. Her husband started working as a driver after he retired from the military so that he could continue supporting their four children.

Wafaa is contributing by adding another tiny source of income from selling kitchenware and decoration pieces. Now she has applied for this loan to increase the quantity of kitchenware she has to sell.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of kitchenware she has to sell.

loans.name: Hasna

texts.en:
Hasna is a 33-year-old illiterate woman. Her husband works in farming, and they have one daughter. 

Being a non-educated person has limited Hasna’s chances for getting a job with a good salary. So she decided to create her own job by selling clothes. Now Hasna has applied for this loan to increase her stock of clothing items that suit the taste of her customers where she lives in Al Karak.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing items.

loans.name: Donia

texts.en:
Donia is a 56-year-old married woman who cares for three daughters and one son. 

Donia’s husband started working in the farming business after he retired from the military. With his help and his experience, Donia built a small greenhouse at her place and planted different types of plants, including vegetables and flowers. Now Donia has applied for this loan to buy more seeds and flower plants.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and flower plants.

loans.name: Fouad
